titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale Political Union Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 08:13

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of correspondence, published materials, minutes, press releases, membership lists, memorabilia, and videotapes documenting the activities and operations of the Yale Political Union.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 40 (YRG 40), Records of Yale clubs, societies, and organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is partially restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale Political Union Records (RU 248). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Yale Political Union was founded in 1934 by A. Whitney Griswold, Max Millikan, and August Heckscher II. Its purpose is to stimulate interest and give training in public affairs. The Political Union is modeled somewhat after the Oxford University and Cambridge University unions, but is organized as a legislature under congressional rules, with floor leaders, honorary guest speakers, and voting on national issues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of correspondence, published materials, minutes, press releases, membership lists, memorabilia, and videotapes documenting the activities and operations of the Yale Political Union.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: Party of the Right, Yale University, Records (RU 1101), (Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

did.unittitle: Constitution, "Guide to Parliamentary Debate," and other internal affairs.
Ejection of the Party of the Right
Minutes of the Executive Board, continued
"History of the Tory Independent Party"; interviews with various people

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This accession is closed. Researchers must secure written permission from a current elected or voting member of the Executive Board of the Yale Political Union to access these materials.
